org.genericsystem.api.core

Interface Cache

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Context, java.io.Serializable

    public interface Cache
extends Context, java.io.Serializable
    A cache is an environment where generics are temporarily stored.
    It is mount on a sub-context that is a cache or a transaction.
    A cache is never threadsafe.
    Author:
    Nicolas Feybesse

      void flush()

      Checks if a generic is alive in this cache

    • Method Detail

      • activate

        Cache activate()
        Activate this cache. The thread becomes aware of which cache it will work.
        Returns:
        the activated cache

      • activateNewSuperCache

        Cache activateNewSuperCache()
        Create a new cache on this cache and activate it.
        Returns:
        the activated new cache

      • deactivate

        Cache deactivate()
        Deactivate this cache.
        Returns:
        this

      • newType

        <T extends Type> T newType(java.io.Serializable value)
        Create new type or get the type with this value if it already exists
        Parameters:
        value - Type name
        Returns:
        new type or the existing type

      • newSubType

        <T extends Type> T newSubType(java.io.Serializable value,
                            Type... superTypes)
        Create new subtype or get the subtype if exists
        Parameters:
        value - Type name
        superTypes - array of super types
        Returns:
        new subtype or the existing subtype

      • flush

        void flush()
           throws RollbackException
        Flush cache in the subcontext (that is a another cache or a transaction)
        Throws:
        RollbackException

      • popCache

        Cache popCache()
        Desactivate current cache and activate the subcontext (that is a simple cache or a transaction)
        Returns:
        the sub Cache
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if subcontext is not a cache, deal directly with a transaction is forbidden.

      • getEngine

        Engine getEngine()
        Return the engine on witch this cache has bean built. If sub context is another cache, return the engine of this another cache.
        Returns:
        the engine

      • isAlive

        boolean isAlive(Generic generic)
        Checks if a generic is alive in this cache
        Parameters:
        generic - checked
        Returns:
        true if generic is alive

      • provide

        <T extends Generic> T provide(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Create or find the generic defined by class param. This class must be @SystemGeneric annotated.
        Parameters:
        clazz - must be @SystemGeneric annotated
        Returns:
        a generic
        See Also:
        SystemGeneric
